 4496:     Pid2 = get_multi_pid(),    
 4497:     g([[sysUpTime,0]]),
 4498:     ?expect1([{[sysUpTime,0], any}]),
 4499:     g([[multiStr,0]]),
 4500:     Pid3 = get_multi_pid(),
 4501:     g([[sysUpTime,0]]),
 4502:     ?expect1([{[sysUpTime,0], any}]),
 4503:     s([{[sysLocation, 0], s, "kalle"}]),
 4504:     Pid3 ! continue,
 4505:     ?expect1([{[multiStr,0], "ok"}]),
 4506:     Pid2 ! continue,
 4507:     ?expect1([{[multiStr,0], "block"}]),
 4508:     ?expect1([{[sysLocation,0], "kalle"}]).
 4509: 
 4510: %% Req. Test1, TestTrapv2
 4511: mt_trap_test(MA, MT) ->
 4512:     ?NPRINT("Testing trap-sending with multi threaded (~w) agent...", [MT]),
 4513:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(01) -> issue testTrapv22 (standard trap)", []),
 4514:     snmpa:send_trap(MA, testTrapv22, "standard trap"),
 4515:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(02) -> await v2trap", []),
 4516:     ?expect2(v2trap, [{[sysUpTime, 0],   any},
 4517: 			    {[snmpTrapOID, 0], ?system ++ [0,1]}]),
 4518: 
 4519:     %% multi-threaded = true
 4520:     %% This will *lock* the 'main thread' of a multi-threaded agent,
 4521:     %% the worker state will be 'busy'. Therefore when a new request
 4522:     %% arrives a new *temporary* worker will be spawned.
 4523:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(03) -> issue mtTrap (standard trap)", []),
 4524:     snmpa:send_trap(MA, mtTrap, "standard trap"),
 4525:     Pid = get_multi_pid(),
 4526:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(04) -> multi pid: ~p. Now request sysUpTime...", [Pid]),
 4527:     g([[sysUpTime,0]]),
 4528: 
 4529:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(06) -> await sysUpTime", []),
 4530:     ?expect1([{[sysUpTime,0], any}]),
 4531: 
 4532:     %% This will *only* work if multi-threaded is 'true', not 'extended'
 4533:     %% since in the latter case all notifications are serialized through
 4534:     %% a dedicated worker, which is now locked (see above).
 4535: 
 4536:     if
 4537:         (MT =:= true) ->
 4538:             ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(07) -> issue testTrapv22 (standard trap)", []),
 4539:             snmpa:send_trap(MA, testTrapv22, "standard trap"),
 4540:             ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(08) -> await v2trap", []),
 4541:             ?expect2(v2trap,
 4542:                            [{[sysUpTime, 0],   any}, 
 4543:                             {[snmpTrapOID, 0], ?system ++ [0,1]}]);
 4544:         true ->
 4545:             ok
 4546:     end,
 4547: 
 4548:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(09) -> send continue to multi-pid", []),
 4549:     Pid ! continue,
 4550: 
 4551:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(10) -> await v2trap", []),
 4552:     ?expect2(v2trap, [{[sysUpTime, 0], any},
 4553: 			    {[snmpTrapOID, 0], ?testTrap ++ [2]},
 4554: 			    {[multiStr,0], "ok"}]),
 4555:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(11) -> done", []),
 4556:     ok.
 4557: 
 4558:     
 4559: get_multi_pid() ->
 4560:     get_multi_pid(10).
 4561: get_multi_pid(0) ->
 4562:     ?FAIL(no_global_name);
 4563: get_multi_pid(N) ->
 4564:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 4565:     case global:whereis_name(snmp_multi_tester) of
 4566: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) -> Pid;
 4567: 	_ -> get_multi_pid(N-1)
 4568:     end.

 4597: %% Req. Test1
 4598: implied_test(MA) ->
 4599:     ?IPRINT("implied_test -> start"),
 4600: 
 4601:     ?NPRINT("Testing IMPLIED..."),
 4602: 
 4603:     snmpa:verbosity(MA, trace),
 4604: 
 4605:     %% Create two rows, check that they are get-nexted in correct order.
 4606:     Idx1 = "apa",
 4607:     Idx2 = "qq",
 4608:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) create row 1 '~s' in table 1",[Idx1]),
 4609:     s([{[testStatus, Idx1], i, ?createAndGo}, {[testDescr, Idx1],s,"row 1"}]),
 4610:     ?expect1([{[testStatus, Idx1], ?createAndGo},
 4611: 		    {[testDescr, Idx1], "row 1"}]),
 4612:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) create row 2 '~s' in table 1",[Idx2]),
 4613:     s([{[testStatus, Idx2], i, ?createAndGo}, {[testDescr, Idx2],s,"row 2"}]),
 4614:     ?expect1([{[testStatus, Idx2], ?createAndGo},
 4615: 		    {[testDescr, Idx2], "row 2"}]),
 4616:     ?DBG("implied_test -> get-next(testDescr)",[]),
 4617:     gn([[testDescr]]),
 4618:     ?expect1([{[testDescr,Idx1], "row 1"}]),
 4619:     ?DBG("implied_test -> get-next(testDescr) of row 1",[]),
 4620:     gn([[testDescr,Idx1]]),
 4621:     ?expect1([{[testDescr,Idx2], "row 2"}]),
 4622: 
 4623:     % Delete the rows
 4624:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) delete row 1 '~s' from table 1",[Idx1]),
 4625:     s([{[testStatus, Idx1], i, ?destroy}]),
 4626:     ?expect1([{[testStatus, Idx1], ?destroy}]),
 4627:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) delete row 2 '~s' from table 1",[Idx2]),
 4628:     s([{[testStatus, Idx2], i, ?destroy}]),
 4629:     ?expect1([{[testStatus, Idx2], ?destroy}]),
 4630: 
 4631:     %% Try the same in other table
 4632:     Idx3 = [1, "apa"],
 4633:     Idx4 = [1, "qq"],
 4634:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) create row 1 '~s' in table 2",[Idx3]),
 4635:     s([{[testStatus2, Idx3], i, ?createAndGo}, {[testDescr2,Idx3],s,"row 1"}]),
 4636:     ?expect1([{[testStatus2, Idx3], ?createAndGo},
 4637: 		    {[testDescr2, Idx3], "row 1"}]),
 4638:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) create row 2 '~s' in table 2",[Idx4]),
 4639:     s([{[testStatus2, Idx4], i, ?createAndGo}, {[testDescr2,Idx4],s,"row 2"}]),
 4640:     ?expect1([{[testStatus2, Idx4], ?createAndGo},
 4641: 		    {[testDescr2, Idx4], "row 2"}]),
 4642:     ?DBG("implied_test -> get-next(testDescr2)",[]),
 4643:     gn([[testDescr2]]),
 4644:     ?expect1([{[testDescr2,Idx3], "row 1"}]),
 4645:     ?DBG("implied_test -> get-next(testDescr2) of row 1",[]),
 4646:     gn([[testDescr2,Idx3]]),
 4647:     ?expect1([{[testDescr2,Idx4], "row 2"}]),
 4648: 
 4649:     % Delete the rows
 4650:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) delete row 1 '~s' from table 2",[Idx3]),
 4651:     s([{[testStatus2, Idx3], i, ?destroy}]),
 4652:     ?expect1([{[testStatus2, Idx3], ?destroy}]),
 4653:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) delete row 2 '~s' from table 2",[Idx4]),
 4654:     s([{[testStatus2, Idx4], i, ?destroy}]),
 4655:     ?expect1([{[testStatus2, Idx4], ?destroy}]),
 4656: 
 4657:     snmpa:verbosity(MA, log),
 4658: 
 4659:     ?IPRINT("implied_test -> done", []),
 4660:     ok.
 4661:

 4695: cnt_64_test(MA) ->
 4696:     ?IPRINT("start cnt64 test (~p)", [MA]),
 4697:     snmpa:verbosity(MA, trace),
 4698:     ?IPRINT("start cnt64 test"),
 4699: 
 4700:     ?NPRINT("Testing Counter64, and at the same time, "
 4701:             "RowStatus is not last column"),
 4702:     
 4703:     ?DBG("get cnt64",[]),
 4704:     g([[cnt64,0]]),
 4705:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4706:     ?v1_2(?expect3(noSuchName, 1, any),
 4707: 		?expect1([{[cnt64,0],18446744073709551615}])),
 4708:     ?DBG("get-next cnt64",[]),
 4709:     gn([[cnt64]]),
 4710:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4711:     ?v1_2(?expect1([{[cnt64Str,0], "after cnt64"}]),
 4712: 		?expect1([{[cnt64,0],18446744073709551615}])),
 4713:     ?DBG("send cntTrap",[]),
 4714:     snmpa:send_trap(MA,cntTrap,"standard trap",[
 4715: 						{sysContact,  "pelle"},
 4716: 						{cnt64,       10},
 4717: 						{sysLocation, "here"}
 4718: 					       ]),
 4719:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4720:     ?v1_2(?expect5(trap, [test], 6, 1, [{[sysContact,0], "pelle"},
 4721: 					      {[sysLocation,0], "here"}]),
 4722: 		?expect2(v2trap, [{[sysUpTime, 0], any},
 4723: 				  {[snmpTrapOID, 0], ?testTrap ++ [1]},
 4724: 				  {[sysContact,0], "pelle"},
 4725: 				  {[cnt64,0], 10},
 4726: 				  {[sysLocation,0], "here"}])),
 4727:     
 4728:     %% Create two rows, check that they are get-nexted in correct order.
 4729:     Idx1 = 1,
 4730:     Idx2 = 2,
 4731:     ?DBG("create row (cntStatus): ~p",[Idx1]),
 4732:     s([{[cntStatus, Idx1], i, ?createAndGo}]),
 4733:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4734:     ?expect1([{[cntStatus, Idx1], ?createAndGo}]),
 4735:     ?DBG("create row (cntStatus): ~p",[Idx2]),
 4736:     s([{[cntStatus, Idx2], i, ?createAndGo}]),
 4737:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4738:     ?expect1([{[cntStatus, Idx2], ?createAndGo}]),
 4739: 
 4740:     ?DBG("get-next (cntIndex)",[]),
 4741:     gn([[cntIndex]]),
 4742:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4743:     ?v1_2(?expect1([{[cntStatus,Idx1], ?active}]),
 4744: 		?expect1([{[cntCnt,Idx1], 0}])),
 4745:     % Delete the rows
 4746:     ?DBG("delete row (cntStatus): ~p",[Idx1]),
 4747:     s([{[cntStatus, Idx1], i, ?destroy}]),
 4748:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4749:     ?expect1([{[cntStatus, Idx1], ?destroy}]),
 4750:     ?DBG("delete row (cntStatus): ~p",[Idx2]),
 4751:     s([{[cntStatus, Idx2], i, ?destroy}]),
 4752:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4753:     ?expect1([{[cntStatus, Idx2], ?destroy}]),
 4754:     catch snmpa:verbosity(MA, log),
 4755:     ?DBG("done",[]),
 4756:     ok.

 5390: %% snmpa_notification_delivery_info_receiver callback function
 5391: delivery_targets(Tag, Addresses, Extra) ->
 5392:     io:format("~w:delivery_targets -> entry with"
 5393: 	      "~n   Tag:       ~p"
 5394: 	      "~n   Addresses: ~p"
 5395: 	      "~n   Extra:     ~p"
 5396: 	      "~n", [?MODULE, Tag, Addresses, Extra]),
 5397:     {value, {_, Pid}} = lists:keysearch(recv, 1, Extra),
 5398:     {value, {_, Ref}} = lists:keysearch(ref,  1, Extra),
 5399:     case lists:keysearch(tag,  1, Extra) of
 5400: 	{value, {_, Tag}} ->
 5401: 	    Pid ! {targets, Ref, ok};
 5402: 	{value, {_, OtherTag}} ->
 5403: 	    Pid ! {targets, Ref, {error, {wrong_tag, Tag, OtherTag}}}
 5404:     end,
 5405:     ok.
 5406: 
 5407: %% snmpa_notification_delivery_info_receiver callback function
 5408: delivery_info(Tag, Address, DeliveryResult, Extra) ->
 5409:     io:format("~w:delivery_info -> entry with"
 5410: 	      "~n   Tag:            ~p"
 5411: 	      "~n   Address:        ~p"
 5412: 	      "~n   DeliveryResult: ~p"
 5413: 	      "~n   Extra:          ~p"
 5414: 	      "~n", [?MODULE, Tag, Address, DeliveryResult, Extra]),
 5415:     {value, {_, Pid}} = lists:keysearch(recv, 1, Extra),
 5416:     {value, {_, Ref}} = lists:keysearch(ref,  1, Extra),
 5417:     case lists:keysearch(tag,  1, Extra) of
 5418: 	{value, {_, Tag}} ->
 5419: 	    Pid ! {info, Ref, ok};
 5420: 	{value, {_, OtherTag}} ->
 5421: 	    Pid ! {info, Ref, {error, {wrong_tag, Tag, OtherTag}}}
 5422:     end,
 5423:     ok.
 5424: 
 5425: 
 5426: command_handler([]) ->    
 5427:     ok;
 5428: command_handler([{_No, _Desc, Cmd}|Rest]) ->
 5429:     ?IPRINT("command_handler -> command ~w: ~n   ~s", [_No, _Desc]),
 5430:     %% case (catch Cmd()) of
 5431:     %%     ok ->
 5432:     %%         ?IPRINT("command_handler -> ~w: ok", [_No]),
 5433:     %%         command_handler(Rest);
 5434:     %%     {error, Reason} ->
 5435:     %%         ?EPRINT("command_handler -> ~w error: ~n~p", [_No, Reason]),
 5436:     %%         ?FAIL(Reason);
 5437:     %%     Error ->
 5438:     %%         ?EPRINT("command_handler -> ~w unexpected: ~n~p", [_No, Error]),
 5439:     %%         ?FAIL({unexpected_command_result, Error})
 5440:     %% end.
 5441:     try Cmd() of
 5442:         ok ->
 5443:             ?IPRINT("command_handler -> ~w: ok", [_No]),
 5444:             command_handler(Rest);
 5445:         {error, Reason} ->
 5446:             ?IPRINT("command_handler -> command ~w error", [_No]),
 5447:             SysEvs = snmp_test_global_sys_monitor:events(),
 5448:             if
 5449:                 (SysEvs =:= []) ->
 5450:                     ?EPRINT("command_handler -> ~w error: ~n~p", [_No, Reason]),
 5451:                     ?FAIL(Reason);
 5452:                 true ->
 5453:                     ?WPRINT("command_handler -> "
 5454:                             "failed when we got system events: "
 5455:                             "~n   Reason:     ~p"
 5456:                             "~n   Sys Events: ~p"
 5457:                             "~n", [Reason, SysEvs]),
 5458:                     ?SKIP([{reason, Reason}, {system_events, SysEvs}])
 5459:             end;
 5460:         Error ->
 5461:             ?IPRINT("command_handler -> command ~w unexpected", [_No]),
 5462:             SysEvs = snmp_test_global_sys_monitor:events(),
 5463:             if
 5464:                 (SysEvs =:= []) ->
 5465:                     ?EPRINT("command_handler -> "
 5466:                             "~w unexpected: ~n~p", [_No, Error]),
 5467:                     ?FAIL({unexpected_command_result, Error});
 5468:                 true ->
 5469:                     ?WPRINT("command_handler -> "
 5470:                             "unexpected when we got system events: "
 5471:                             "~n   Unexpected: ~p"
 5472:                             "~n   Sys Events: ~p"
 5473:                             "~n", [Error, SysEvs]),
 5474:                     ?SKIP([{unexpected, Error}, {system_events, SysEvs}])
 5475:             end
 5476:     catch
 5477:         C:E:S ->
 5478:             ?IPRINT("command_handler -> command ~w caught", [_No]),
 5479:             SysEvs = snmp_test_global_sys_monitor:events(),
 5480:             if
 5481:                 (SysEvs =:= []) ->
 5482:                     ?EPRINT("command_handler -> ~w caught: "
 5483:                             "~n   Class: ~p"
 5484:                             "~n   Error: ~p"
 5485:                             "~n   Stack: ~p", [_No, C, E, S]),
 5486:                     ?FAIL({catched_command_result, {C, E, S}});
 5487:                 true ->
 5488:                     ?WPRINT("command_handler -> "
 5489:                             "caught when we got system events: "
 5490:                             "~n   Caught: "
 5491:                             "~n      Class:   ~p"
 5492:                             "~n      Error:   ~p"
 5493:                             "~n      Stack:   ~p"
 5494:                             "~n   Sys Events: ~p"
 5495:                             "~n", [C, E, S, SysEvs]),
 5496:                     ?SKIP([{caught, {C, E, S}}, {system_events, SysEvs}])
 5497:             end
 5498:     end.
 5499:     
 5500:

 5556: %% Req. SA-MIB, OLD-SNMPEA-MIB
 5557: sa_errs_bad_value() ->
 5558:     NewKeyc3 = [intCommunityEntry,[3],get(mip),is("test")],
 5559:     NewKeyc4 = [intCommunityEntry,[4],get(mip),is("test")],
 5560:     NewKeyc5 = [intCommunityEntry,[5],get(mip),is("test")],
 5561:     s([{NewKeyc3, 2},
 5562:        {[sa, [2,0]], 5}, % badValue (i is_set_ok)
 5563:        {NewKeyc5, ?createAndGo},
 5564:        {NewKeyc4, 2}]),
 5565:     ?expect3(badValue, 2, any),
 5566:     s([{NewKeyc3, 2},
 5567:        {[sa, [2,0]], 6}, % wrongValue (i is_set_ok)
 5568:        {NewKeyc5, ?createAndGo},
 5569:        {NewKeyc4, 2}]),
 5570:     ?expect3(?v1_2(badValue, wrongValue), 2, any),
 5571:     g([NewKeyc4]),
 5572:     ?v1_2(?expect3(noSuchName, 1, any),
 5573: 		?expect1([{NewKeyc4, noSuchInstance}])).
 5574: 
 5575: %% Req. SA-MIB, OLD-SNMPEA-MIB
 5576: sa_errs_gen_err() ->
 5577:     NewKeyc3 = [intCommunityEntry,[3],get(mip),is("test")],
 5578:     NewKeyc4 = [intCommunityEntry,[4],get(mip),is("test")],
 5579:     NewKeyc5 = [intCommunityEntry,[5],get(mip),is("test")],
 5580:     s([{NewKeyc3, 2},{NewKeyc4, 2},
 5581:        {NewKeyc5, ?createAndGo}, {[sa, [3,0]], 5}]),
 5582:     ?expect3(genErr, 4, any),
 5583: % The row might have been added; we don't know.
 5584: % (as a matter of fact we do - it is added, because the agent
 5585: % first sets its own vars, and then th SAs. Lets destroy it.
 5586:     s([{NewKeyc5, ?destroy}]),
 5587:     ?expect1([{NewKeyc5, ?destroy}]).
 5588:

 5591:     g([[sa, [4,0]]]),

 5600: %% snmp_test_mgr:s([{[fStatus3, 1], 4}, {[fname3,0], "ok"}]). -> noError
 5601: %% snmp_test_mgr:s([{[fStatus3, 1], 4}, {[fname3,0], "hoj"}]). -> {badValue, 2}
 5602: %% snmp_test_mgr:s([{[fStatus3, 3], 4}, {[fname3,0], "hoj"}]). -> {genErr, 1}
 5603: %% snmp_test_mgr:s([{[fStatus3, 4], 4}, {[fname3,0], "ok"}]). -> {genErr, 1}
 5604: %% snmp_test_mgr:s([{[fStatus3, 4], 4}, {[fname3,0], "ufail"}]). -> {genErr, 1}

 5607: undo_test() ->
 5608:     s([{[fStatus3, 1], 4}, {[fname3,0], "ok"}]),
 5609:     ?expect1([{[fStatus3, 1], 4}, {[fname3,0], "ok"}]),
 5610:     s([{[fStatus3, 1], 4}, {[fname3,0], "hoj"}]),
 5611:     ?expect3(?v1_2(badValue, inconsistentValue), 2, any),
 5612:     s([{[fStatus3, 3], 4}, {[fname3,0], "hoj"}]),
 5613:     ?expect3(?v1_2(genErr, undoFailed), 1, any),
 5614:     s([{[fStatus3, 4], 4}, {[fname3,0], "ok"}]),
 5615:     ?expect3(?v1_2(genErr, commitFailed), 1, any),
 5616: % unfortunately we don't know if we'll get undoFailed or commitFailed.
 5617: % it depends on which order the agent traverses the varbind list.
 5618: %    s([{[fStatus3, 4], 4}, {[fname3,0], "ufail"}]),
 5619: %    expect(5, ?v1_2(genErr, undoFailed), 1, any),
 5620:     s([{[fStatus3, 1], 4}, {[fname3,0], "xfail"}]),
 5621:     ?expect3(genErr, 2, any).
 5622:

 5624: bad_return() ->
 5625:     g([[fStatus4,4],
 5626:        [fName4,4]]),
 5627:     ?expect3(genErr, 2, any),
 5628:     g([[fStatus4,5],
 5629:        [fName4,5]]),
 5630:     ?expect3(genErr, 1, any),
 5631:     g([[fStatus4,6],
 5632:        [fName4,6]]),
 5633:     ?expect3(genErr, 2, any),
 5634:     gn([[fStatus4,7],
 5635:        [fName4,7]]),
 5636:     ?expect3(genErr, 2, any),
 5637:     gn([[fStatus4,8],
 5638:        [fName4,8]]),
 5639:     ?expect3(genErr, 1, any),
 5640:     gn([[fStatus4,9],
 5641:        [fName4,9]]),
 5642:     ?expect3(genErr, 2, any).

 5678:     ?P(snmp_standard_mib),

 5680:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_init", []),
 5681:     try_test(std_mib_init),
 5682:

 5685:     put(vsn, v2),
 5686: 
 5687:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_read", []),
 5688:     try_test(std_mib_read),
 5689:     put(vsn, v1),
 5690: 
 5691:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_b (~w)", [InBadVsns]),
 5692:     Bad = try_test(std_mib_b, [InBadVsns]),
 5693: 
 5694:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_read (community: 'bad community')", []),
 5695:     try_test(std_mib_read, [], [{community, "bad community"}]),
 5696: 
 5697:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_write (community: 'public')", []),
 5698:     try_test(std_mib_write, [], [{community, "public"}]),
 5699: 
 5700:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_asn_err", []),
 5701:     try_test(std_mib_asn_err),
 5702: 
 5703:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_c (~w)", [Bad]),
 5704:     try_test(std_mib_c, [Bad]),
 5705: 
 5706:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_a", []),
 5707:     try_test(standard_mib_a),
 5708:     
 5709:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_finish", []),
 5710:     try_test(std_mib_finish),
 5711: 
 5712:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_test_finish", []),
 5713:     try_test(standard_mib_test_finish, [], [{community, "bad community"}]).
 5714: 
 5715: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB
 5716: standard_mib_a() ->
 5717:     [OutPkts]  = get_req(2, [[snmpOutPkts,0]]),
 5718:     [OutPkts2] = get_req(3, [[snmpOutPkts,0]]),
 5719:     OutPkts2   = OutPkts + 1,
 5720:     %% There are some more counters we could test here, but it's not that
 5721:     %% important, since they are removed from SNMPv2-MIB.
 5722:     ok.
 5723: 
 5724: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB | SNMPv2-MIB
 5725: std_mib_init() ->
 5726:     %% disable authentication failure traps.  (otherwise w'd get many of
 5727:     %% them - this is also a test to see that it works).
 5728:     s([{[snmpEnableAuthenTraps,0], 2}]),
 5729:     ?expect1([{[snmpEnableAuthenTraps, 0], 2}]).
 5730: 
 5731: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB | SNMPv2-MIB
 5732: std_mib_finish() ->
 5733:     %% enable again
 5734:     s([{[snmpEnableAuthenTraps,0], 1}]),
 5735:     ?expect1([{[snmpEnableAuthenTraps, 0], 1}]).
 5736: 
 5737: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB
 5738: standard_mib_test_finish() ->
 5739:     %% force a authenticationFailure (should result in a trap)
 5740:     std_mib_write(),
 5741:     %% check that we got a trap
 5742:     ?expect5(trap, [1,2,3], 4, 0, []).
 5743: 
 5744: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB | SNMPv2-MIB
 5745: std_mib_read() ->
 5746:     ?DBG("std_mib_read -> entry", []),
 5747:     g([[sysUpTime,0]]), % try a bad <something>; msg dropped, no reply
 5748:     ?DBG("std_mib_read -> await timeout (i.e. no reply)", []),
 5749:     ?expect1(timeout). % make sure we don't get a trap!
 5750: 
 5751: 
 5752: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB | SNMPv2-MIB
 5753: std_mib_write() ->
 5754:     ?DBG("std_mib_write -> entry", []),
 5755:     s([{[sysLocation, 0], "new_value"}]).
 5756:

 5758: std_mib_asn_err() ->

 5803:     try_test(std_mib_asn_err),
 5804: 
 5805:     ?DBG("snmpv2_mib_2 -> check counters",[]),
 5806:     try_test(std_mib_c, [Bad]),
 5807: 
 5808:     ?DBG("snmpv2_mib_2 -> get some counters",[]),
 5809:     try_test(snmpv2_mib_a),
 5810:

 5812:     try_test(std_mib_finish),
 5813: 
 5814:     ?DBG("snmpv2_mib_2 -> force auth failure, and await trap, "
 5815:          "then disable auth traps", []),
 5816:     try_test(snmpv2_mib_test_finish, [], [{community, "bad community"}]),
 5817:     
 5818:     ?IPRINT("snmpv2_mib_2 -> done"),
 5819:     ok.

 5834: %% Req. SNMPv2-MIB
 5835: snmpv2_mib_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 5836:     %% <CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 5837:     Skippable = [{unix, [darwin]}],
 5838:     Condition = fun() -> ?OS_BASED_SKIP(Skippable) end,
 5839:     ?NON_PC_TC_MAYBE_SKIP(Config, Condition),
 5840:     %% </CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 5841: 
 5842:     ?P(snmpv2_mib_3), 
 5843:     init_case(Config),
 5844: 
 5845:     InBadVsns = try_test(std_mib_a),
 5846:     put(vsn, v1),
 5847:     try_test(std_mib_read),
 5848:     put(vsn, v3),
 5849:     _Bad = try_test(std_mib_b, [InBadVsns]),
 5850:     try_test(snmpv2_mib_a),
 5851: 
 5852:     try_test(std_mib_finish).
 5853:     
 5854: -define(authenticationFailure, [1,3,6,1,6,3,1,1,5,5]).
 5855: 
 5856: %% Req. SNMPv2-MIB
 5857: snmpv2_mib_test_finish() ->
 5858:     %% force a authenticationFailure
 5859:     ?DBG("ma_v2_inform -> write to std mib",[]),
 5860:     std_mib_write(),
 5861: 
 5862:     %% check that we got a trap
 5863:     ?DBG("ma_v2_inform -> await trap",[]),
 5864:     ?expect2(v2trap, [{[sysUpTime,0], any},
 5865: 			    {[snmpTrapOID,0], ?authenticationFailure}]),
 5866: 
 5867:     %% and the the inform
 5868:     ?DBG("ma_v2_inform -> await inform",[]),
 5869:     ?expect2({inform,true}, [{[sysUpTime,0], any},
 5870: 				   {[snmpTrapOID,0],?authenticationFailure}]).
 5871: 
 5872: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB | SNMPv2-MIB
 5873: std_mib_a() ->
 5874:     [InPkts] = get_req(2, [[snmpInPkts,0]]),
 5875:     [InPkts2] = get_req(3, [[snmpInPkts,0]]),
 5876:     InPkts2 = InPkts + 1,
 5877: 
 5878:     [InBadVsns] = get_req(4, [[snmpInBadVersions,0]]),
 5879:     InBadVsns.
 5880: 
 5881: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB | SNMPv2-MIB
 5882: std_mib_b(InBadVsns) ->
 5883:     [InBadVsns2] = get_req(1, [[snmpInBadVersions,0]]),
 5884:     InBadVsns2 = InBadVsns + 1,
 5885:     [InPkts] = get_req(2, [[snmpInPkts,0]]),
 5886:     [InPkts2] = get_req(3, [[snmpInPkts,0]]),
 5887:     InPkts2 = InPkts + 1,
 5888:     [InBadCommunityNames, InBadCommunityUses, InASNErrs] =
 5889: 	get_req(4, [[snmpInBadCommunityNames,0],
 5890: 		    [snmpInBadCommunityUses,0],
 5891: 		    [snmpInASNParseErrs, 0]]),
 5892:     {InBadCommunityNames, InBadCommunityUses, InASNErrs}.
 5893:     
 5894: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB | SNMPv2-MIB
 5895: std_mib_c({InBadCommunityNames, InBadCommunityUses, InASNErrs}) ->
 5896:     [InBadCommunityNames2, InBadCommunityUses2, InASNErrs2] =
 5897: 	get_req(1, [[snmpInBadCommunityNames,0],
 5898: 		    [snmpInBadCommunityUses,0],
 5899: 		    [snmpInASNParseErrs, 0]]),
 5900:     InBadCommunityNames2 = InBadCommunityNames + 1,
 5901:     InBadCommunityUses2 = InBadCommunityUses + 1,
 5902:     InASNErrs2 = InASNErrs + 1.
 5903: 
 5904: %% Req. SNMPv2-MIB
 5905: snmpv2_mib_a() ->
 5906:     [SetSerial] = get_req(2, [[snmpSetSerialNo,0]]),
 5907:     s([{[snmpSetSerialNo,0], SetSerial}, {[sysLocation, 0], "val2"}]),
 5908:     ?expect1([{[snmpSetSerialNo,0], SetSerial},
 5909: 		    {[sysLocation, 0], "val2"}]),
 5910:     s([{[sysLocation, 0], "val3"}, {[snmpSetSerialNo,0], SetSerial}]),
 5911:     ?expect3(inconsistentValue, 2,
 5912: 		   [{[sysLocation, 0], "val3"},
 5913: 		    {[snmpSetSerialNo,0], SetSerial}]),
 5914:     ["val2"] = get_req(5, [[sysLocation,0]]),
 5915:     ok.
 5916:     
 5917:     
 5918: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 5919: %% o  Bad community uses/name is tested already
 5920: %%    in SNMPv2-MIB and STANDARD-MIB.
 5921: %% o  Test add/deletion of rows.
 5922: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 5923: snmp_community_mib(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 5924:     ?P(snmp_community_mib),

 5928:     unload_master("SNMP-COMMUNITY-MIB").
 5929:

 5938: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 5939: %% o  Test engine boots / time
 5940: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 5941: snmp_framework_mib(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 5942:     ?P(snmp_framework_mib), 
 5943:     init_case(Config),
 5944:     load_master_std("SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB"),
 5945:     try_test(snmp_framework_mib_test),
 5946:     unload_master("SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB").
 5947: 
 5948: snmp_framework_mib_2(X) -> ?P(snmp_framework_mib_2), snmp_framework_mib(X).
 5949: 
 5950: snmp_framework_mib_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 5951:     ?P(snmp_framework_mib_3), 
 5952:     init_case(Config),
 5953:     try_test(snmp_framework_mib_test).
 5954: 
 5955: 
 5956: %% Req. SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB
 5957: %% snmpEngineTime (in number of seconds).
 5958: %% In theory, the Engine Time diff of the engine, should be exactly
 5959: %% the same as the number of seconds we sleep (5 in this case).
 5960: %% But because, on some (slow or/and high loaded) hosts, the actual
 5961: %% time we sleep could be a lot larger (due to, for instance, scheduling).
 5962: %% Therefore we must take that into account when we check if the 
 5963: %% Engine Time diff (between the two checks) is acceptably.
 5964: snmp_framework_mib_test() ->
 5965: 
 5966:     ?IPRINT("transports: "
 5967:             "~n      ~p"
 5968:             "~ninfo: "
 5969:             "~n      ~p",
 5970:             [
 5971:              rpc:call(get(master_node), snmpa, which_transports, []),
 5972:              rpc:call(get(master_node), snmpa, info, [])
 5973:             ]),
 5974: 
 5975:     Sleep = 5,
 5976:     ["agentEngine"] = get_req(1, [[snmpEngineID,0]]),
 5977:     T1 = snmp_misc:now(ms),
 5978:     [EngineTime] = get_req(2, [[snmpEngineTime,0]]),
 5979:     T2 = snmp_misc:now(ms),
 5980:     ?SLEEP(?SECS(Sleep)),
 5981:     T3 = snmp_misc:now(ms),
 5982:     [EngineTime2] = get_req(3, [[snmpEngineTime,0]]),
 5983:     T4 = snmp_misc:now(ms),
 5984: 
 5985:     %% Ok, we tried to sleep 5 seconds, but how long did we actually sleep
 5986:     ASleep         = ((T3-T2) + 500) div 1000,
 5987:     EngineTimeDiff = EngineTime2 - EngineTime,
 5988:     HighEngineTime = EngineTime + ASleep + 2,
 5989:     LowEngineTime  = EngineTime + ASleep - 1,
 5990: 
 5991:     ?IPRINT("snmp_framework_mib -> time(s): "
 5992:             "~n   EngineTime 1:                         ~p"
 5993:             "~n      Time to acquire:                   ~w msec"
 5994:             "~n   EngineTime 2:                         ~p"
 5995:             "~n      Time to acquire:                   ~w msec"
 5996:             "~n   => Total time to acquire:             ~w msec"
 5997:             "~n      Sleep between get(snmpEngineTime): ~w (~w) sec"
 5998:             "~n      Engine Time Diff:                  ~w sec"
 5999:             "~n      Success if:"
 6000:             "~n           ~w (low) =< Engine Time 2 =< ~w (high)",
 6001:             [EngineTime, T2-T1, 
 6002:              EngineTime2, T4-T3,
 6003:              T4-T1, ASleep, Sleep, EngineTimeDiff, LowEngineTime, HighEngineTime]),
 6004: 
 6005:     %% In our environment, get'ing the snmpEngineTime should only take
 6006:     %% a couple of milli sec (less then 100).
 6007:     %% So just as a sanity check, we check that it its < 1000ms.
 6008:     %% We do have a couple of machines that are "unstable"...
 6009: 
 6010:     ?IPRINT("check that all snmpEngineTime acquire < 1000"),
 6011:     if
 6012:         ((T2 - T1) >= 1000) ->
 6013:             ?WPRINT("Failed snmpEngineTime 1 sanity check: "
 6014:                     "~n      Time to acquire ~w >= 1000", [T2-T1]),
 6015:             ?SKIP({acquire, snmpEngineTime, 1, T1, T2});
 6016:         ((T4 - T3) >= 1000) ->
 6017:             ?WPRINT("Failed snmpEngineTime 2 sanity check: "
 6018:                     "~n      Time to acquire ~w >= 1000", [T4-T3]),
 6019:             ?SKIP({acquire, snmpEngineTime, 2, T3, T4});
 6020:         true ->
 6021:             ok
 6022:     end,
 6023: 
 6024:     if
 6025:         (HighEngineTime < EngineTime2) ->
 6026:             ?EPRINT("snmp_framework_mib -> (High) Engine Time diff (~w) too large: "
 6027:                     "~n      ~w < ~w",
 6028:                     [EngineTimeDiff, HighEngineTime, EngineTime2]),
 6029:             ?FAIL({too_large_diff, EngineTime, EngineTime2});
 6030:         (LowEngineTime > EngineTime2) ->
 6031:              ?EPRINT("snmp_framework_mib -> (Low) Engine Time diff (~w) too large: "
 6032:                     "~n      ~w > ~w",
 6033:                     [EngineTimeDiff, LowEngineTime, EngineTime2]),
 6034:             ?FAIL({too_large_diff, EngineTime, EngineTime2});
 6035:         true -> 
 6036:             ok
 6037:     end,
 6038: 
 6039:     T5 = snmp_misc:now(ms),
 6040:     case get_req(4, [[snmpEngineBoots,0]]) of
 6041: 	      [Boots] when is_integer(Boots) -> 
 6042:                   T6 = snmp_misc:now(ms),
 6043:                   ?IPRINT("snmp_framework_mib -> "
 6044:                           "~n   boots: ~p"
 6045:                           "~n      Time to acquire: ~w ms", [Boots, T6-T5]),
 6046: 		  ok;
 6047: 	      Else -> 
 6048:                   ?EPRINT("snmp_framework_mib -> failed get proper boots:"
 6049:                           "~n   ~p", [Else]),
 6050: 		  ?FAIL({invalid_boots, Else})
 6051: 	  end,
 6052:     ok.
 6053:

 6056: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 6057: snmp_mpd_mib_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 6058:     %% <CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 6059:     Skippable = [{unix, [darwin]}],
 6060:     Condition = fun() -> ?OS_BASED_SKIP(Skippable) end,
 6061:     ?NON_PC_TC_MAYBE_SKIP(Config, Condition),
 6062:     %% </CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 6063: 
 6064:     ?P(snmp_mpd_mib_3), 
 6065:     init_case(Config),
 6066:     UnknownPDUHs = try_test(snmp_mpd_mib_a),
 6067:     try_test(snmp_mpd_mib_b, [], [{context_engine_id, "bad engine"}]),
 6068:     try_test(snmp_mpd_mib_c, [UnknownPDUHs]).
 6069:     
 6070: 
 6071: %% Req. SNMP-MPD-MIB
 6072: snmp_mpd_mib_a() ->
 6073:     [UnknownSecs, InvalidMsgs] =
 6074: 	get_req(1, [[snmpUnknownSecurityModels,0],
 6075: 		    [snmpInvalidMsgs,0]]),
 6076:     Pdu = #pdu{type = 'get-request',
 6077: 	       request_id = 23,
 6078: 	       error_status = noError,
 6079: 	       error_index = 0,
 6080: 	       varbinds = []},
 6081:     SPdu = #scopedPdu{contextEngineID = "agentEngine",
 6082: 		      contextName = "",
 6083: 		      data = Pdu},
 6084:     SPDUBytes = snmp_pdus:enc_scoped_pdu(SPdu),
 6085:     V3Hdr1 = #v3_hdr{msgID = 21,
 6086: 		     msgMaxSize = 484,
 6087: 		     msgFlags = [7],
 6088: 		     msgSecurityModel = 23,  % bad sec model
 6089: 		     msgSecurityParameters = []},
 6090:     V3Hdr2 = #v3_hdr{msgID = 21,
 6091: 		     msgMaxSize = 484,
 6092: 		     msgFlags = [6], % bad flag combination
 6093: 		     msgSecurityModel = 3,
 6094: 		     msgSecurityParameters = []},
 6095:     Message1 = #message{version = 'version-3', vsn_hdr = V3Hdr1,
 6096: 			data = SPDUBytes},
 6097:     Message2 = #message{version = 'version-3', vsn_hdr = V3Hdr2,
 6098: 			data = SPDUBytes},
 6099:     MsgBytes1 = snmp_pdus:enc_message_only(Message1),
 6100:     MsgBytes2 = snmp_pdus:enc_message_only(Message2),
 6101:     snmp_test_mgr:send_bytes(MsgBytes1),
 6102:     snmp_test_mgr:send_bytes(MsgBytes2),
 6103: 
 6104:     [UnknownSecs2, InvalidMsgs2, UnknownPDUHs] =
 6105: 	get_req(1, [[snmpUnknownSecurityModels,0],
 6106: 		    [snmpInvalidMsgs,0],
 6107: 		    [snmpUnknownPDUHandlers, 0]]),
 6108:     UnknownSecs2 = UnknownSecs + 1,
 6109:     InvalidMsgs2 = InvalidMsgs + 1,
 6110:     UnknownPDUHs.
 6111: 
 6112: -define(snmpUnknownPDUHandlers_instance, [1,3,6,1,6,3,11,2,1,3,0]).
 6113: snmp_mpd_mib_b() ->
 6114:     g([[sysUpTime,0]]),
 6115:     ?expect2(report, [{?snmpUnknownPDUHandlers_instance, any}]).
 6116:     
 6117: 
 6118: snmp_mpd_mib_c(UnknownPDUHs) ->
 6119:     [UnknownPDUHs2] = get_req(1, [[snmpUnknownPDUHandlers, 0]]),
 6120:     UnknownPDUHs2 = UnknownPDUHs + 1,
 6121:     ok.
 6122:

 6157: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 6158: %% o  add/delete views and try them
 6159: %% o  try boundaries
 6160: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 6161: snmp_view_based_acm_mib(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 6162:     ?P(snmp_view_based_acm_mib), 
 6163:     init_case(Config),
 6164: 
 6165:     load_master_std("SNMP-VIEW-BASED-ACM-MIB"),
 6166:     load_master("Test2"),
 6167:     snmp_view_based_acm_mib(),
 6168:     unload_master("Test2"),
 6169:     unload_master("SNMP-VIEW-BASED-ACM-MIB").
 6170: 
 6171: snmp_view_based_acm_mib_2(X) -> 
 6172:     ?P(snmp_view_based_acm_mib_2), 
 6173:     snmp_view_based_acm_mib(X).
 6174: 
 6175: snmp_view_based_acm_mib_3(X) -> 
 6176:     %% <CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 6177:     Skippable = [{unix, [darwin]}],
 6178:     Condition = fun() -> ?OS_BASED_SKIP(Skippable) end,
 6179:     ?NON_PC_TC_MAYBE_SKIP(X, Condition),
 6180:     %% </CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 6181: 
 6182:     ?P(snmp_view_based_acm_mib_3), 
 6183:     snmp_view_based_acm_mib(X).
 6184: 
 6185: snmp_view_based_acm_mib() ->
 6186:     snmpa:verbosity(net_if,trace),
 6187:     snmpa:verbosity(master_agent,trace),
 6188:     ?IPRINT("start snmp_view_based_acm_mib test"),
 6189:     %% The user "no-rights" is present in USM, and is mapped to security
 6190:     %% name 'no-rights", which is not present in VACM.
 6191:     %% So, we'll add rights for it, try them and delete them.
 6192:     %% We'll give "no-rights" write access to tDescr.0 and read access
 6193:     %% to tDescr2.0
 6194:     %% These are the options we'll use to the mgr
 6195:     Opts = [{user, "no-rights"}, {community, "no-rights"}],
 6196:     %% Find the valid secmodel, and one invalid secmodel.
 6197:     {SecMod, InvSecMod} = 
 6198: 	case get(vsn) of
 6199: 	    v1 -> {?SEC_V1, ?SEC_V2C};
 6200: 	    v2 -> {?SEC_V2C, ?SEC_USM};
 6201: 	    v3 -> {?SEC_USM, ?SEC_V1}
 6202: 	end,
 6203:     ?DBG("assign rights for 'no-rights'",[]),
 6204:     try_test(use_no_rights, [], Opts),
 6205: 
 6206:     %% Now, add a mapping from "no-rights" -> "no-rights-group"
 6207:     GRow1Status = [vacmSecurityToGroupStatus,[SecMod, 9,"no-rights"]],
 6208:     GRow1 = 
 6209: 	[{[vacmGroupName, [SecMod, 9,"no-rights"]], "no-rights-group"},
 6210: 	 {GRow1Status, ?createAndGo}],
 6211:     ?DBG("set '~p'",[GRow1]),
 6212:     try_test(do_set, [GRow1]),
 6213: 
 6214:     ?DBG("assign rights for 'no-rights'",[]),
 6215:     try_test(use_no_rights, [], Opts),
 6216: 
 6217:     %% Create a mapping for another sec model, and make sure it doesn't
 6218:     %% give us access
 6219:     GRow2Status = [vacmSecurityToGroupStatus,[InvSecMod, 9,"no-rights"]],
 6220:     GRow2 = [{[vacmGroupName, [InvSecMod, 9, "no-rights"]], "initial"},
 6221: 	     {GRow2Status, ?createAndGo}],
 6222: 
 6223:     ?DBG("set '~p'",[GRow2]),
 6224:     try_test(do_set, [GRow2]),
 6225: 
 6226:     ?DBG("assign rights for 'no-rights'",[]),
 6227:     try_test(use_no_rights, [], Opts),
 6228: 
 6229:     %% Delete that row
 6230:     try_test(del_row, [GRow2Status]),
 6231:     
 6232:     RVName = "rv_name",
 6233:     WVName = "wv_name",
 6234: 
 6235:     %% Access row
 6236:     ARow1Idx = [15 | "no-rights-group"] ++ [0, ?SEC_ANY, 1],
 6237:     ARow1Status = [vacmAccessStatus, ARow1Idx],
 6238:     ARow1 = [{[vacmAccessContextMatch, ARow1Idx], 1},
 6239: 	     {[vacmAccessReadViewName, ARow1Idx], RVName},
 6240: 	     {[vacmAccessWriteViewName, ARow1Idx], WVName},
 6241: 	     {ARow1Status, ?createAndGo}],
 6242:     
 6243:     %% This access row would give access, if InvSecMod was valid.
 6244:     ARow2Idx = [15 | "no-rights-group"] ++ [0, InvSecMod, 1],
 6245:     ARow2Status = [vacmAccessStatus, ARow2Idx],
 6246:     ARow2 = [{[vacmAccessContextMatch, ARow2Idx], 1},
 6247: 	     {[vacmAccessReadViewName, ARow2Idx], "internet"},
 6248: 	     {[vacmAccessWriteViewName, ARow2Idx], "internet"},
 6249: 	     {ARow2Status, ?createAndGo}],
 6250:     
 6251:     try_test(do_set, [ARow2]),
 6252: 
 6253:     try_test(use_no_rights, [], Opts),
 6254: 
 6255:     %% Delete that row
 6256:     try_test(del_row, [ARow2Status]),
 6257:     
 6258: 
 6259:     %% Add valid row
 6260:     try_test(do_set, [ARow1]),
 6261: 
 6262:     try_test(use_no_rights, [], Opts),
 6263: 
 6264:     %% Create the view family
 6265:     VRow1Idx = mk_ln(RVName) ++ mk_ln(?xDescr),         % object access
 6266:     VRow2Idx = mk_ln(RVName) ++ mk_ln(?xDescr2 ++ [0]), % instance access
 6267:     VRow3Idx = mk_ln(WVName) ++ mk_ln(?xDescr),         % object access
 6268:     VRow4Idx = mk_ln(WVName) ++ mk_ln(?xDescr ++ [0]),  % instance access
 6269:     VRow1Status = [vacmViewTreeFamilyStatus, VRow1Idx],
 6270:     VRow2Status = [vacmViewTreeFamilyStatus, VRow2Idx],
 6271:     VRow3Status = [vacmViewTreeFamilyStatus, VRow3Idx],
 6272:     VRow4Status = [vacmViewTreeFamilyStatus, VRow4Idx],
 6273:     
 6274:     try_test(add_row, [VRow1Status]),
 6275:     try_test(add_row, [VRow2Status]),
 6276:     try_test(add_row, [VRow3Status]),
 6277: 
 6278:     %% We're supposed to have access now...
 6279:     try_test(use_rights, [], Opts),
 6280: 
 6281:     %% Change Row3 to Row4
 6282:     try_test(del_row, [VRow3Status]),
 6283:     try_test(add_row, [VRow4Status]),
 6284: 
 6285:     %% We should still have access...
 6286:     try_test(use_rights, [], Opts),
 6287: 
 6288:     %% Delete rows
 6289:     try_test(del_row, [GRow1Status]),
 6290:     
 6291:     try_test(use_no_rights, [], Opts),
 6292: 
 6293:     %% Delete rest of rows
 6294:     try_test(del_row, [ARow1Status]),
 6295:     try_test(del_row, [VRow1Status]),
 6296:     try_test(del_row, [VRow2Status]),
 6297:     try_test(del_row, [VRow4Status]),
 6298: 
 6299:     try_test(use_no_rights, [], Opts),
 6300:     snmpa:verbosity(master_agent,log).
 6301: 
 6302: do_set(Row) ->
 6303:     s(Row),
 6304:     ?expect1(Row).
 6305:     
 6306: add_row(RowStatus) ->
 6307:     s([{RowStatus, ?createAndGo}]),
 6308:     ?expect1([{RowStatus, ?createAndGo}]).
 6309: 
 6310: del_row(RowStatus) ->
 6311:     s([{RowStatus, ?destroy}]),
 6312:     ?expect1([{RowStatus, ?destroy}]).
 6313:     
 6314:     
 6315: 
 6316: use_no_rights() ->
 6317:     g([[xDescr,0]]),
 6318:     ?v1_2_3(?expect3(noSuchName, 1, any),
 6319: 	    ?expect1([{[xDescr,0], noSuchObject}]),
 6320: 	    ?expect3(authorizationError, 1, any)),
 6321:     g([[xDescr2,0]]),
 6322:     ?v1_2_3(?expect3(noSuchName, 1, any),
 6323: 	    ?expect1([{[xDescr2,0], noSuchObject}]),
 6324: 	    ?expect3(authorizationError, 1, any)),
 6325:     gn([[xDescr]]),
 6326:     ?v1_2_3(?expect3(noSuchName, 1, any),
 6327: 	    ?expect1([{[xDescr], endOfMibView}]),
 6328: 	    ?expect3(authorizationError, 1, any)),
 6329:     s([{[xDescr,0], "tryit"}]),
 6330:     ?v1_2_3(?expect3(noSuchName, 1, any),
 6331: 	    ?expect3(noAccess, 1, any),
 6332: 	    ?expect3(authorizationError, 1, any)).
 6333: 
 6334: 
 6335: use_rights() ->
 6336:     g([[xDescr,0]]),
 6337:     ?expect1([{[xDescr,0], any}]),
 6338:     g([[xDescr2,0]]),
 6339:     ?expect1([{[xDescr2,0], any}]),
 6340:     s([{[xDescr,0], "tryit"}]),
 6341:     ?expect3(noError, 0, any),
 6342:     g([[xDescr,0]]),
 6343:     ?expect1([{[xDescr,0], "tryit"}]).
 6344: 
 6345: mk_ln(X) ->
 6346:     [length(X) | X].
 6347: 
 6348: 
 6349: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 6350: %% o  add/delete users and try them
 6351: %% o  test all secLevels
 6352: %% o  test all combinations of protocols
 6353: %% o  try bad ops; check counters
 6354: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 6355: snmp_user_based_sm_mib_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 6356:     %% <CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 6357:     Skippable = [{unix, [darwin]}],
 6358:     Condition = fun() -> ?OS_BASED_SKIP(Skippable) end,
 6359:     ?NON_PC_TC_MAYBE_SKIP(Config, Condition),
 6360:     %% </CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 6361: 
 6362:     ?P(snmp_user_based_sm_mib_3), 
 6363:     init_case(Config),
 6364: 
 6365:     _AgentDir = ?config(agent_conf_dir, Config),
 6366:     load_master_std("SNMP-USER-BASED-SM-MIB"),
 6367: 
 6368:     %% The newUser used here already has VACM access.
 6369:     
 6370:     %% Add a new user in the simplest way; just createAndGo
 6371:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_add_user1, []}]],
 6372: 	[{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "privDES"}]),
 6373: 
 6374:     %% Try to use the new user
 6375:     load_master("Test2"),
 6376:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_use_user, []}]],
 6377: 	[{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "newUser"}]),
 6378:     unload_master("Test2"),
 6379: 
 6380:     ShaKey1 = snmp:passwd2localized_key(sha, "new sha password", "agentEngine"),
 6381:     DesKey1 = lists:sublist(ShaKey1, 16),
 6382: 
 6383:     %% Change the new user's keys - 1
 6384:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_key_change1, [ShaKey1, DesKey1]}]],
 6385: 	[{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "newUser"}]),
 6386: 
 6387:     %% Try to use the new keys
 6388:     MgrDir = ?config(mgr_dir, Config),
 6389:     rewrite_usm_mgr(MgrDir, ShaKey1, DesKey1),
 6390:     load_master("Test2"),
 6391:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_use_user, []}]],
 6392: 	[{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "newUser"}]),
 6393:     unload_master("Test2"),
 6394: 
 6395:     ShaKey2 = snmp:passwd2localized_key(sha, "newer password", "agentEngine"),
 6396:     DesKey2 = lists:sublist(ShaKey2, 16),
 6397: 
 6398:     %% Change the new user's keys - 2
 6399:     try_test(v3_sync,
 6400: 	      [[{usm_key_change2, [ShaKey1, DesKey1, ShaKey2, DesKey2]}]],
 6401: 	      [{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "newUser"}]),
 6402: 
 6403:     %% Try to use the new keys
 6404:     reset_usm_mgr(MgrDir),
 6405:     rewrite_usm_mgr(MgrDir, ShaKey2, DesKey2),
 6406:     load_master("Test2"),
 6407:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_use_user, []}]],
 6408: 	      [{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "newUser"}]),
 6409:     unload_master("Test2"),
 6410:     reset_usm_mgr(MgrDir),
 6411: 
 6412:     %% Change the new user's keys - 3
 6413:     try_test(v3_sync,
 6414: 	      [[{usm_key_change3, [ShaKey2, DesKey2, ShaKey1, DesKey1]}]],
 6415: 	      [{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "privDES"}]),
 6416: 
 6417:     %% Try to use the new keys
 6418:     rewrite_usm_mgr(MgrDir, ShaKey1, DesKey1),
 6419:     load_master("Test2"),
 6420:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_use_user, []}]],
 6421: 	[{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "newUser"}]),
 6422:     unload_master("Test2"),
 6423:     reset_usm_mgr(MgrDir),
 6424: 
 6425:     %% Try some read requests
 6426:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_read, []}]],
 6427: 		   [{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "privDES"}]),
 6428: 
 6429:     %% Delete the new user
 6430:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_del_user, []}]],
 6431: 		   [{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "privDES"}]),
 6432: 
 6433:     %% Try some bad requests
 6434:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_bad, []}]],
 6435: 		   [{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "privDES"}]),
 6436: 
 6437:     unload_master("SNMP-USER-BASED-SM-MIB").
 6438: 
 6439: -define(usmUserSecurityName, [1,3,6,1,6,3,15,1,2,2,1,3]).
 6440: 
 6441: usm_add_user1() ->
 6442:     NewRowIndex = [11,"agentEngine", 7, "newUser"],
 6443:     RowPointer = ?usmUserSecurityName ++ [11|"agentEngine"] ++ [7|"privDES"],
 6444:     Vbs1  = [{[usmUserCloneFrom, NewRowIndex], RowPointer},
 6445: 	     {[usmUserStatus, NewRowIndex], ?createAndGo}],
 6446:     s(Vbs1),
 6447:     ?expect1(Vbs1),
 6448:     ok.
 6449:     
 6450: usm_use_user() ->
 6451:     v2_proc().
 6452: 
 6453: 
 6454: %% Change own public keys
 6455: usm_key_change1(ShaKey, DesKey) ->
 6456:     NewRowIndex = [11,"agentEngine", 7, "newUser"],
 6457:     ShaKeyChange = snmp_user_based_sm_mib:mk_key_change(sha,
 6458: 							"passwd_shaxxxxxxxxxx",
 6459: 							ShaKey),
 6460:     DesKeyChange = snmp_user_based_sm_mib:mk_key_change(sha,
 6461: 							"passwd_desxxxxxx",
 6462: 							DesKey),
 6463:     Vbs1 = [{[usmUserAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ShaKeyChange},
 6464: 	    {[usmUserPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex], DesKeyChange}],
 6465:     s(Vbs1),
 6466:     ?expect1(Vbs1).
 6467:     
 6468: %% Change own private keys
 6469: usm_key_change2(OldShaKey, OldDesKey, ShaKey, DesKey) ->
 6470:     NewRowIndex = [11,"agentEngine", 7, "newUser"],
 6471:     ShaKeyChange = snmp_user_based_sm_mib:mk_key_change(sha,
 6472: 							OldShaKey,
 6473: 							ShaKey),
 6474:     DesKeyChange = snmp_user_based_sm_mib:mk_key_change(sha,
 6475: 							OldDesKey,
 6476: 							DesKey),
 6477:     Vbs1 = [{[usmUserOwnAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ShaKeyChange},
 6478: 	    {[usmUserOwnPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex], DesKeyChange}],
 6479:     s(Vbs1),
 6480:     ?expect1(Vbs1).
 6481:     
 6482: %% Change other's public keys
 6483: usm_key_change3(OldShaKey, OldDesKey, ShaKey, DesKey) ->
 6484:     NewRowIndex = [11,"agentEngine", 7, "newUser"],
 6485:     ShaKeyChange = snmp_user_based_sm_mib:mk_key_change(sha,
 6486: 							OldShaKey,
 6487: 							ShaKey),
 6488:     DesKeyChange = snmp_user_based_sm_mib:mk_key_change(sha,
 6489: 							OldDesKey,
 6490: 							DesKey),
 6491:     Vbs1 = [{[usmUserOwnAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ShaKeyChange}],
 6492:     s(Vbs1),
 6493:     ?expect3(noAccess, 1, any),
 6494:     Vbs2 = [{[usmUserOwnPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex], DesKeyChange}],
 6495:     s(Vbs2),
 6496:     ?expect3(noAccess, 1, any),
 6497:     
 6498:     
 6499:     Vbs3 = [{[usmUserAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ShaKeyChange},
 6500: 	    {[usmUserPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex], DesKeyChange}],
 6501:     s(Vbs3),
 6502:     ?expect1(Vbs3),
 6503:     ok.
 6504: 
 6505: usm_read() ->
 6506:     NewRowIndex = [11,"agentEngine", 7, "newUser"],
 6507:     g([[usmUserSecurityName, NewRowIndex],
 6508: 	     [usmUserCloneFrom, NewRowIndex],
 6509: 	     [usmUserAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex],
 6510: 	     [usmUserOwnAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex],
 6511: 	     [usmUserPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex],
 6512: 	     [usmUserOwnPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex]]),
 6513:     ?expect1([{[usmUserSecurityName, NewRowIndex], "newUser"},
 6514: 		    {[usmUserCloneFrom, NewRowIndex], [0,0]},
 6515: 		    {[usmUserAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ""},
 6516: 		    {[usmUserOwnAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ""},
 6517: 		    {[usmUserPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ""},
 6518: 		    {[usmUserOwnPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ""}]),
 6519:     ok.
 6520:     
 6521:     
 6522: 
 6523: usm_del_user() ->
 6524:     NewRowIndex = [11,"agentEngine", 7, "newUser"],
 6525:     Vbs1  = [{[usmUserStatus, NewRowIndex], ?destroy}],
 6526:     s(Vbs1),
 6527:     ?expect1(Vbs1),
 6528:     ok.
 6529: 
 6530: -define(usmUserCloneFrom, [1,3,6,1,6,3,15,1,2,2,1,4]).
 6531: 
 6532: -define(usmNoAuthProtocol, [1,3,6,1,6,3,10,1,1,1]).
 6533: 
 6534: -define(usmHMACMD5AuthProtocol, [1,3,6,1,6,3,10,1,1,2]).
 6535: 
 6536: -define(usmHMACSHAAuthProtocol, [1,3,6,1,6,3,10,1,1,3]).
 6537: 
 6538: -define(usmNoPrivProtocol, [1,3,6,1,6,3,10,1,2,1]).
 6539: 
 6540: -define(usmDESPrivProtocol, [1,3,6,1,6,3,10,1,2,2]).
 6541: 
 6542: usm_bad() ->
 6543:     NewRowIndex = [11,"agentEngine", 7, "newUser"],
 6544:     RowPointer1 = ?usmUserSecurityName ++ [11|"agentEngine"] ++ [7|"privDOS"],
 6545:     Vbs1  = [{[usmUserCloneFrom, NewRowIndex], RowPointer1},
 6546: 	     {[usmUserStatus, NewRowIndex], ?createAndGo}],
 6547:     s(Vbs1),
 6548:     ?expect3(inconsistentName, 1, any),
 6549: 
 6550:     RowPointer2 = ?usmUserCloneFrom ++ [11|"agentEngine"] ++ [7|"privDES"],
 6551:     Vbs2  = [{[usmUserCloneFrom, NewRowIndex], RowPointer2},
 6552: 	     {[usmUserStatus, NewRowIndex], ?createAndGo}],
 6553:     s(Vbs2),
 6554:     ?expect3(wrongValue, 1, any),
 6555: 
 6556:     RowPointer3 = ?usmUserSecurityName ++ [11|"agentEngine"] ++ [7|"privDES"],
 6557:     Vbs3  = [{[usmUserCloneFrom, NewRowIndex], RowPointer3},
 6558: 	     {[usmUserStatus, NewRowIndex], ?createAndGo}],
 6559:     s(Vbs3),
 6560:     ?expect1(Vbs3),
 6561:     s([{[usmUserAuthProtocol, NewRowIndex], ?usmNoAuthProtocol}]),
 6562:     ?expect3(inconsistentValue, 1, any),
 6563:     s([{[usmUserAuthProtocol, NewRowIndex], ?usmHMACMD5AuthProtocol}]),
 6564:     ?expect3(inconsistentValue, 1, any),
 6565:     s([{[usmUserAuthProtocol, NewRowIndex], ?usmDESPrivProtocol}]),
 6566:     ?expect3(wrongValue, 1, any),
 6567:     s([{[usmUserPrivProtocol, NewRowIndex], ?usmHMACSHAAuthProtocol}]),
 6568:     ?expect3(wrongValue, 1, any),
 6569: 
 6570:     Vbs4  = [{[usmUserStatus, NewRowIndex], ?destroy}],
 6571:     s(Vbs4),
 6572:     ?expect1(Vbs4),
 6573:     ok.
 6574:     
 6575: 
 6576: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 6577: %% Loop through entire MIB, to make sure that all instrum. funcs
 6578: %% works.
 6579: %% Load all std mibs that are not loaded by default.
 6580: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 6581: loop_mib_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 6582:     ?P(loop_mib_1),
 6583:     ?IPRINT("loop_mib_1 -> initiate case"),
 6584: 
 6585:     {_SaNode, _MgrNode, _MibDir} = init_case(Config),
 6586:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> ~n"
 6587: 	   "\tSaNode:  ~p~n"
 6588: 	   "\tMgrNode: ~p~n"
 6589: 	   "\tMibDir:  ~p",[_SaNode, _MgrNode, _MibDir]),
 6590:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> load mib SNMP-COMMUNITY-MIB",[]),
 6591:     load_master_std("SNMP-COMMUNITY-MIB"),
 6592:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> load mib SNMP-MPD-MIB",[]),
 6593:     load_master_std("SNMP-MPD-MIB"),
 6594:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> load mib SNMP-TARGET-MIB",[]),
 6595:     load_master_std("SNMP-TARGET-MIB"),
 6596:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> load mib SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB",[]),
 6597:     load_master_std("SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB"),
 6598:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> load mib SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB",[]),
 6599:     load_master_std("SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB"),
 6600:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> load mib SNMP-VIEW-BASED-ACM-MIB",[]),
 6601:     load_master_std("SNMP-VIEW-BASED-ACM-MIB"),
 6602:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> try",[]),
 6603: 
 6604:     try_test(loop_mib_1_test),
 6605: 
 6606:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> unload mib SNMP-COMMUNITY-MIB",[]),
 6607:     unload_master("SNMP-COMMUNITY-MIB"),
 6608:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> unload mib SNMP-MPD-MIB",[]),
 6609:     unload_master("SNMP-MPD-MIB"),
 6610:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> unload mib SNMP-TARGET-MIB",[]),
 6611:     unload_master("SNMP-TARGET-MIB"),
 6612:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> unload mib SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB",[]),
 6613:     unload_master("SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB"),
 6614:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> unload mib SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB",[]),
 6615:     unload_master("SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB"),
 6616:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> unload mib SNMP-VIEW-BASED-ACM-MIB",[]),
 6617:     unload_master("SNMP-VIEW-BASED-ACM-MIB"),
 6618:     %% snmpa:verbosity(master_agent,log),
 6619:     %% snmpa:verbosity(mib_server,silence),
 6620:     ?IPRINT("loop_mib_1 -> done"),
 6621:     ok.
 6622:     
 6623:

 6628:     ?DBG("do_loop_mib_2 -> ~n"

 6632:     ?DBG("loop_mib_2 -> load mibs",[]),

 6643:     unload_master("SNMP-COMMUNITY-MIB"),
 6644:     unload_master("SNMP-MPD-MIB"),
 6645:     unload_master("SNMP-TARGET-MIB"),
 6646:     unload_master("SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB"),
 6647:     unload_master("SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB"),

 6677: 
 6678: %% Req. As many mibs all possible
 6679: loop_mib_1_test() ->
 6680:     ?IPRINT("loop_mib_1_test -> entry"),
 6681:     N = loop_it_1([1,1], 0),
 6682:     ?IPRINT("found ~w variables", [N]),
 6683:     N = if N < 100 -> 100;
 6684: 		 true -> N
 6685: 	      end.
 6686: 
 6687: loop_it_1(Oid, N) ->
 6688:     ?IPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> entry with"
 6689:             "~n      Oid: ~p"
 6690:             "~n      N:   ~p", [Oid, N]),
 6691:     case get_next_req([Oid]) of
 6692: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6693: 	     error_status = noError, 
 6694: 	     error_index  = 0,
 6695: 	     varbinds     = [#varbind{oid   = NOid,
 6696: 				      value = _Value}]} when NOid > Oid ->
 6697: 	    ?IPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> "
 6698:                     "expected intermediate (get-next) result: "
 6699:                     "~n   NOid:  ~p"
 6700:                     "~n   Value: ~p", [NOid, _Value]),
 6701: 	    [_Value2] = get_req(1, [NOid]), % must not be same
 6702: 	    ?IPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> expected intermediate (get) result: "
 6703:                     "~n   Value2: ~p", [_Value2]),
 6704: 	    loop_it_1(NOid, N+1);
 6705: 
 6706: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6707: 	     error_status = noError, 
 6708: 	     error_index  = 0,
 6709: 	     varbinds     = Vbs} ->
 6710:             ?EPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> unexpected (get-response) vbs: "
 6711:                     "~n      Vbs: ~p", [Vbs]),
 6712: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_vbs,
 6713:                          [{get_next_oid, Oid}, 
 6714:                           {counter,      N},
 6715:                           {varbinds,     Vbs}]});
 6716: 
 6717: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6718: 	     error_status = noSuchName, 
 6719: 	     error_index = 1,
 6720: 	     varbinds    = [_]} ->
 6721: 	    ?IPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> done: ~p", [N]),
 6722: 	    N;
 6723: 
 6724: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6725: 	     error_status = Err, 
 6726: 	     error_index  = Idx,
 6727: 	     varbinds     = Vbs} ->
 6728:             ?EPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> unexpected (get-response) pdu: "
 6729:                     "~n      Err: ~p"
 6730:                     "~n      Idx: ~p"
 6731:                     "~n      Vbs: ~p", [Err, Idx, Vbs]),
 6732: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_pdu,
 6733:                          [{get_next_oid, Oid},
 6734:                           {counter,      N},
 6735:                           {error_status, Err},
 6736:                           {error_index,  Idx},
 6737:                           {varbinds,     Vbs}]});
 6738: 
 6739: 	#pdu{type         = Type, 
 6740: 	     error_status = Err, 
 6741: 	     error_index  = Idx,
 6742: 	     varbinds     = Vbs} ->
 6743:             ?EPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> unexpected pdu: "
 6744:                     "~n      Type: ~p"
 6745:                     "~n      Err:  ~p"
 6746:                     "~n      Idx:  ~p"
 6747:                     "~n      Vbs:  ~p", [Type, Err, Idx, Vbs]),
 6748: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_pdu,
 6749:                          [{get_next_oid, Oid},
 6750:                           {counter,      N},
 6751:                           {type,         Type},
 6752:                           {error_status, Err},
 6753:                           {error_index,  Idx},
 6754:                           {varbinds,     Vbs}]});
 6755: 
 6756: 	{error, Reason} ->
 6757:             %% Regardless of the error here (its usually timeout),
 6758:             %% if we have had system events we skip since the results
 6759:             %% in those cases are simply not reliable.
 6760:             %% There is just no point in trying to analyze the reason.
 6761:             ?IPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> receive error: "
 6762:                     "~n      ~p", [Reason]),
 6763:             SysEvs = snmp_test_global_sys_monitor:events(),
 6764:             if
 6765:                 (SysEvs =:= []) ->
 6766:                     ?EPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> error: "
 6767:                             "~n      ~p", [Reason]),
 6768:                     ?FAIL([{get_next_oid, Oid},
 6769:                                  {counter,      N},
 6770:                                  {reason,       Reason}]);
 6771: 
 6772:                         true ->
 6773:                     ?WPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> "
 6774:                             "error when we got system events: "
 6775:                             "~n   Reason:     ~p"
 6776:                             "~n   Sys Events: ~p"
 6777:                             "~n", [Reason, SysEvs]),
 6778:                     ?SKIP([{reason, Reason}, {system_events, SysEvs}])
 6779:             end
 6780:     end.
 6781: 	    
 6782: 
 6783: %% Req. As many mibs as possible
 6784: loop_mib_2_test() ->
 6785:     ?IPRINT("loop_mib_2_test -> entry"),
 6786:     N = loop_it_2([1,1], 0),
 6787:     ?IPRINT("found ~w variables", [N]),
 6788:     N = if N < 100 -> 100;
 6789: 		 true -> N
 6790: 	      end.
 6791: 
 6792: loop_it_2(Oid, N) ->
 6793:     ?IPRINT("loop_it_2 -> entry with"
 6794:             "~n   Oid: ~p"
 6795:             "~n   N:   ~p", [Oid, N]),
 6796:     case get_next_req([Oid]) of
 6797: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6798: 	     error_status = noError, 
 6799: 	     error_index  = 0,
 6800: 	     varbinds     = [#varbind{oid = _NOid, value = endOfMibView}]} ->
 6801: 	    ?IPRINT("loop_it_2 -> done: "
 6802:                     "~n   NOid: ~p", [_NOid]),
 6803: 	    N;
 6804: 
 6805: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6806: 	     error_status = noError, 
 6807: 	     error_index  = 0,
 6808: 	     varbinds     = [#varbind{oid   = NOid,
 6809: 				      value = _Value}]} when NOid > Oid ->
 6810: 	    ?IPRINT("loop_it_2 -> "
 6811:                     "expected intermediate (get-next) result: "
 6812:                     "~n   NOid:  ~p"
 6813:                     "~n   Value: ~p", [NOid, _Value]),
 6814: 	    [_Value2] = get_req(1, [NOid]), % must not be same
 6815: 	    ?IPRINT("loop_it_2 -> expected intermediate (get) result: "
 6816:                     "~n   Value2: ~p", [_Value2]),
 6817: 	    loop_it_2(NOid, N+1);
 6818: 
 6819: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6820: 	     error_status = noError, 
 6821: 	     error_index  = 0,
 6822: 	     varbinds     = Vbs} ->
 6823:             ?EPRINT("loop_it_2 -> unexpected (get-response) vbs: "
 6824:                     "~n      Vbs: ~p", [Vbs]),
 6825: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_vbs,
 6826:                          [{get_next_oid, Oid},
 6827:                           {counter,      N},
 6828:                           {varbinds,     Vbs}]});
 6829: 
 6830: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6831: 	     error_status = ES, 
 6832: 	     error_index  = EI,
 6833: 	     varbinds     = Vbs} ->
 6834:             ?EPRINT("loop_it_2 -> unexpected (get-response) pdu: "
 6835:                     "~n      ES:  ~p"
 6836:                     "~n      EI:  ~p"
 6837:                     "~n      Vbs: ~p", [ES, EI, Vbs]),
 6838: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_pdu,
 6839:                          [{get_next_oid, Oid},
 6840:                           {counter,      N},
 6841:                           {error_status, ES}, 
 6842:                           {error_index,  EI},
 6843:                           {varbinds,     Vbs}]});
 6844: 
 6845: 	#pdu{type         = Type, 
 6846: 	     error_status = ES, 
 6847: 	     error_index  = EI,
 6848: 	     varbinds     = Vbs} ->
 6849:             ?EPRINT("loop_it_2 -> unexpected pdu: "
 6850:                     "~n      Type: ~p"
 6851:                     "~n      ES:   ~p"
 6852:                     "~n      EI:   ~p"
 6853:                     "~n      Vbs:  ~p", [Type, ES, EI, Vbs]),
 6854: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_pdu,
 6855:                          [{get_next_oid, Oid},
 6856:                           {counter,      N},
 6857:                           {type,         Type}, 
 6858:                           {error_status, ES}, 
 6859:                           {error_index,  EI},
 6860:                           {varbinds,     Vbs}]});
 6861: 
 6862: 	{error, Reason} ->
 6863:             %% Regardless of the error here (its usually timeout),
 6864:             %% if we have had system events we skip since the results
 6865:             %% in those cases are simply not reliable.
 6866:             %% There is just no point in trying to analyze the reason.
 6867:             ?IPRINT("loop_it_2 -> receive error: "
 6868:                     "~n      ~p", [Reason]),
 6869:             SysEvs = snmp_test_global_sys_monitor:events(),
 6870:             if
 6871:                 (SysEvs =:= []) ->
 6872:                     ?EPRINT("loop_it_2 -> error *without* system events: "
 6873:                             "~n   Oid:    ~p"
 6874:                             "~n   N:      ~p"
 6875:                             "~n   Reason: ~p", [Oid, N,Reason]),
 6876:                     ?FAIL([{get_next_oid, Oid},
 6877:                            {counter,      N},
 6878:                            {reason,       Reason}]);
 6879: 
 6880:                 true ->
 6881:                     ?WPRINT("loop_it_2 -> "
 6882:                             "error *with* system events: "
 6883:                             "~n   Oid:        ~p"
 6884:                             "~n   N:          ~p"
 6885:                             "~n   Reason:     ~p"
 6886:                             "~n   Sys Events: ~p"
 6887:                             "~n", [Oid, N, Reason, SysEvs]),
 6888:                     ?SKIP([{reason, Reason}, {system_events, SysEvs}])
 6889:             end
 6890:     end.
 6891: 	    
 6892: loop_mib_3_test() ->
 6893:     ?DBG("loop_mib_3_test -> entry",[]),
 6894:     loop_mib_2_test().
 6895:

 7031: otp_1131_3(X) -> 
 7032:     %% <CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 7033:     %% This is intended to catch Montavista Linux 4.0/ppc (2.6.5)
 7034:     %% Montavista Linux looks like a Debian distro (/etc/issue)
 7035:     LinuxVersionVerify = 
 7036: 	fun() ->
 7037: 		case string:to_lower(os:cmd("uname -m")) of
 7038: 		    "ppc" ++ _ ->
 7039: 			case file:read_file_info("/etc/issue") of
 7040: 			    {ok, _} ->
 7041: 				case string:to_lower(
 7042:                                        os:cmd("grep -i montavista /etc/issue")) of
 7043: 				    "montavista" ++ _ ->
 7044: 					case os:version() of
 7045: 					    {2, 6, 10} ->
 7046:                                                 ?IPRINT("(PPC Linux) kernel version check: "
 7047:                                                         "{2, 6, 10} => SKIP"),
 7048: 						true;
 7049: 					    V ->
 7050:                                                 ?IPRINT("(PPC Linux) kernel version check: "
 7051:                                                         "~p != {2, 6, 10} => *NO* SKIP", [V]),
 7052: 						false
 7053: 					end;
 7054: 				    _ -> % Maybe plain Debian or Ubuntu
 7055:                                         ?IPRINT("(PPC Linux) Not MontaVista => *NO* SKIP"),
 7056: 					false
 7057: 				end;
 7058: 			    _ ->
 7059: 				%% Not a Debian based distro
 7060:                                 ?IPRINT("(PPC Linux) Unknown distro => *NO* SKIP"),
 7061: 				false
 7062: 			end;
 7063: 		    _ ->
 7064:                         ?IPRINT("(Linux) Not PPC => *NO* SKIP"),
 7065: 			false
 7066: 		end
 7067: 	end,
 7068:     Skippable = [{unix, [darwin, {linux, LinuxVersionVerify}]}],
 7069:     Condition = fun() -> ?OS_BASED_SKIP(Skippable) end,
 7070:     ?NON_PC_TC_MAYBE_SKIP(X, Condition),
 7071:     %% </CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 7072:

 7074:     otp_1131(X).

 7280:        { 2, true,  Dt02_valid},

 7294: validate_dat(L) -> validate_dat(L,[]).
 7295:  
 7296: validate_dat([],V) -> 
 7297:   Fun = fun({_,X}) -> case X of
 7298:                         ok -> false;
 7299:                         _  -> true
 7300:                       end
 7301:         end,
 7302:   validate_dat1( lists:reverse( lists:filter(Fun,V) ) );
 7303: validate_dat([{Id,E,Dat}|T],V) ->
 7304:   validate_dat(T,[validate_dat2(Id,E,Dat) | V]).
 7305:  
 7306: validate_dat1([]) -> ok;
 7307: validate_dat1(L)  -> {error,L}.
 7308:  
 7309: validate_dat2(Id, E, Dat) ->
 7310:   Res = case {E,snmp:validate_date_and_time(Dat)} of
 7311:           {E,E} -> ok;
 7312:           {E,A} -> {E,A}
 7313:         end,
 7314:   {Id, Res}.

 7361: 			   if E == endOfTable ->
 7362: 					?FAIL(endOfTable);
 7363: 				       true -> ok
 7364: 				end
 7365: 		   end, Elements).

 7593: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 7594: %% Ticket: OTP-16092
 7595: %% Slogan: Extra socket options
 7596: %%         We perform simple start and stop tests with and without
 7597: %%         this option.
 7598: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 7599: 
 7600: otp16092_cases() ->
 7601:     [
 7602:      otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop1, % default
 7603:      otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop2, % []
 7604:      otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop3, % bad => ignored
 7605:      otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop4  % invalid content
 7606:     ].
 7607: 
 7608: otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop1(Config) ->
 7609:     otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7610:                                     Config, default, success).
 7611: 
 7612: 
 7613: otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop2(Config) ->
 7614:     otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7615:                                     Config, [], success).
 7616: 
 7617: 
 7618: otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop3(Config) ->
 7619:     otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7620:                                     Config,
 7621:                                     'this-should-be-ignored',
 7622:                                     success).
 7623: 
 7624: 
 7625: otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop4(Config) ->
 7626:     otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7627:                                     Config,
 7628:                                     ['this-should-fail'],
 7629:                                     failure).
 7630: 
 7631: otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop(CaseName, Config, ESO, Expected)
 7632:   when is_atom(CaseName) ->
 7633:     Pre  = fun() ->
 7634:                    [D|_] = lists:reverse(atom_to_list(CaseName)),
 7635:                    Digit = [D],
 7636:                            
 7637:                    ?NPRINT("try start agent node"),
 7638:                    {ok, Peer, Node} = ?START_PEER(Digit ++ "-agent"),
 7639: 
 7640:                    ?NPRINT("try write config to file"),
 7641:                    ConfDir   = ?config(agent_conf_dir, Config),
 7642:                    DbDir     = ?config(agent_db_dir,   Config),
 7643:                    Vsns      = [v1],
 7644:                    IP        = tuple_to_list(?config(ip, Config)),
 7645:                    ManagerIP = IP,
 7646:                    TrapPort  = ?TRAP_UDP,
 7647:                    AgentIP   = IP,
 7648:                    AgentPort = 4000,
 7649:                    SysName   = "test",
 7650:                    ok = snmp_config:write_agent_snmp_files(ConfDir, Vsns,
 7651:                                                            ManagerIP, TrapPort,
 7652:                                                            AgentIP, AgentPort,
 7653:                                                            SysName),
 7654: 
 7655:                    #{eso       => ESO,
 7656:                      vsns      => Vsns,
 7657:                      db_dir    => DbDir,
 7658:                      conf_opts => [{dir,        ConfDir},
 7659:                                    {force_load, false}, 
 7660:                                    {verbosity,  trace}],
 7661:                      node      => Node,
 7662:                      peer      => Peer,
 7663:                      expected  => Expected}
 7664:            end,
 7665:     Case = fun(State) ->
 7666:                    do_otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop(State)
 7667:            end,
 7668:     Post = fun(#{node := Node,
 7669:                  peer := Peer}) ->
 7670:                    ?NPRINT("try stop agent node ~p", [Node]),
 7671:                    ?STOP_PEER(Peer)
 7672:            end,
 7673:     ?TC_TRY(CaseName, Pre, Case, Post).
 7674: 
 7675: do_otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop(#{eso       := ESO,
 7676:                                      vsns      := Vsns,
 7677:                                      db_dir    := DbDir,
 7678:                                      conf_opts := ConfOpts,
 7679:                                      node      := Node,
 7680:                                      expected  := Expected} = _State) ->
 7681:     NiOpts =
 7682:         case ESO of
 7683:             default ->
 7684:                 [{verbosity, trace}];
 7685:             _ -> 
 7686:                 [{verbosity, trace}, {options, [{extra_sock_opts, ESO}]}]
 7687:         end,
 7688: 
 7689:     Opts = [{agent_type, master},
 7690:             {versions,   Vsns},
 7691:             {db_dir,     DbDir},
 7692:             {config,     ConfOpts},
 7693:             {net_if,     NiOpts}],
 7694: 
 7695:     otp16092_try_start_and_stop_agent(Node, Opts, Expected),
 7696: 
 7697:     ?NPRINT("done"),
 7698:     ok.
 7699: 
 7700: otp16092_try_start_and_stop_agent(Node, Opts, Expected) ->
 7701:     ?IPRINT("try start snmp (agent) supervisor (on ~p) - expect ~p", 
 7702:             [Node, Expected]),
 7703:     case start_standalone_agent(Node, Opts) of
 7704:         {ok, Pid} when is_pid(Pid) andalso (Expected =:= success) ->
 7705:             ?IPRINT("Expected success starting snmp (agent) supervisor"),
 7706:             ?SLEEP(1000),
 7707:             stop_standalone_agent(Pid),
 7708:             ok;
 7709:         {ok, Pid} when is_pid(Pid) andalso (Expected =:= failure) ->
 7710:             ?EPRINT("Unexpected success starting snmp (agent) supervisor: (~p)",
 7711:                     [Pid]),
 7712:             ?SLEEP(1000),
 7713:             stop_standalone_agent(Pid),
 7714:             ?FAIL('unexpected-start-success');
 7715: 
 7716:         {error,
 7717:          shutdown,
 7718:          {failed_to_start_child, snmpa_agent_sup,
 7719:           {shutdown,
 7720:            {failed_to_start_child, snmpa_agent,
 7721:             {net_if_error, Reason}}}}} when (Expected =:= failure) ->
 7722:             ?IPRINT("Expected (shutdown, net-if) error starting "
 7723:                     "snmp (agent) supervisor (on ~p):"
 7724:                     "~n   ~p", [Node, Reason]),
 7725:             ok;
 7726:         {error, {shutdown, Reason}} when (Expected =:= failure) ->
 7727:             ?IPRINT("Expected (shutdown) error starting "
 7728:                     "snmp (agent) supervisor (on ~p):"
 7729:                     "~n   ~p", [Node, Reason]),
 7730:             ok;
 7731:         {error, Reason} when (Expected =:= failure) ->
 7732:             ?IPRINT("Expected error starting snmp (agent) supervisor (on ~p):"
 7733:                     "~n   ~p", [Node, Reason]),
 7734:             ok;
 7735: 
 7736:         {badrpc, 
 7737:          {'EXIT',
 7738:           {shutdown,
 7739:            {failed_to_start_child, snmpa_agent_sup,
 7740:             {shutdown,
 7741:              {failed_to_start_child, snmpa_agent,
 7742:               {net_if_error, Reason}}}}}}} when (Expected =:= failure) ->
 7743:             ?IPRINT("Expected (badrpc, shutdown, net-if) error starting "
 7744:                     "snmp (agent) supervisor (on ~p):"
 7745:                     "~n   ~p", [Node, Reason]),
 7746:             ok;
 7747:         {badrpc, {'EXIT', {shutdown, Reason}}} when (Expected =:= failure) ->
 7748:             ?IPRINT("Expected (badrpc, shutdown) error starting "
 7749:                     "snmp (agent) supervisor (on ~p):"
 7750:                     "~n   ~p", [Node, Reason]),
 7751:             ok;
 7752:         {badrpc, {'EXIT', Reason}} when (Expected =:= failure) ->
 7753:             ?IPRINT("Expected (badrpc) error starting snmp (agent) supervisor "
 7754:                       "(on ~p):"
 7755:                     "~n   ~p", [Node, Reason]),
 7756:             ok;
 7757: 
 7758:         {badrpc, Reason} = BADRPC ->
 7759:             ?WPRINT("Bad RPC to node ~p failed:"
 7760:                     "~n   ~p", [Node, Reason]),
 7761:             ?SKIP({BADRPC, Node})
 7762: 
 7763:     end,
 7764:     ok.
 7765:

 7888:     "OTP-8395 - ATL with sequence numbering. ";
 7889: 
 7890: otp8395(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 7891:     ?DBG("otp8395 -> entry with"
 7892: 	 "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
 7893: 
 7894:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 7895: 
 7896:     %% This is just to dirty trick for the ***old*** test-code
 7897:     put(mgr_node, ?config(manager_node, Config)), 
 7898:     put(mgr_dir,  ?config(manager_top_dir, Config)),
 7899:     put(mib_dir,  ?config(mib_dir, Config)),
 7900:     put(vsn, v1), 
 7901:     put(master_host, ?config(agent_host, Config)),
 7902:     put(ipfamily, ?config(ipfamily, Config)),
 7903:     try_test(simple_standard_test),
 7904: 
 7905:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 7906:     AgentNode   = ?config(agent_node, Config),
 7907:     AgentLogDir = ?config(agent_log_dir, Config),
 7908:     OutFile     = join([AgentLogDir, "otp8395.txt"]),
 7909:     {ok, _LogInfo} = rpc:call(AgentNode, snmpa, log_info, []),
 7910:     ?DBG("otp8395 -> LogInfo: ~p", [_LogInfo]), 
 7911:

 7913:     %% ?DBG("otp8395 -> SyncRes: ~p", [SyncRes]), 
 7914: 
 7915:     ok = agent_log_validation(AgentNode),
 7916:     _LTTRes = 
 7917: 	rpc:call(AgentNode, snmpa, log_to_txt, [AgentLogDir, [], OutFile]), 
 7918:     ?DBG("otp8395 -> LTTRes: ~p", [_LTTRes]),

 7927: otp9884({init, Config}) when is_list(Config) ->
 7928:     ?DBG("otp9884(init) -> entry with"
 7929: 	 "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
 7930:     init_v1_agent([{fname, otp9884}, {ipfamily, inet} | Config]);
 7931: 
 7932: otp9884({fin, Config}) when is_list(Config) ->
 7933:     ?DBG("otp9884(fin) -> entry with"
 7934: 	 "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
 7935:     fin_v1_agent(Config);
 7936: 
 7937: otp9884(doc) ->
 7938:     "OTP-9884 - Simultaneous backup(s) call should not work. ";
 7939: 
 7940: otp9884(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 7941:     ?DBG("otp9884 -> entry with"
 7942: 	 "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
 7943: 
 7944:     AgentNode = ?config(agent_node, Config),
 7945:     [AgentBkpDir1, AgentBkpDir2] = ?config(agent_backup_dirs, Config),
 7946:     Self = self(), 
 7947:     timer:apply_after(1000,
 7948: 		      ?MODULE,
 7949:                       otp9884_backup,
 7950:                       [AgentNode, Self, first,  AgentBkpDir1]),
 7951:     timer:apply_after(1000,
 7952: 		      ?MODULE,
 7953:                       otp9884_backup,
 7954:                       [AgentNode, Self, second, AgentBkpDir2]),
 7955:     otp9884_await_backup_started(),
 7956:     otp9884_await_backup_completion(undefined, undefined),
 7957: 
 7958:     ?DBG("otp9884 -> done", []),
 7959:     ok.
 7960: 
 7961: 
 7962: otp9884_backup(Node, Pid, Tag, Dir) ->
 7963:     ?IPRINT("[~w] backup - await continue", [Tag]),
 7964:     Pid ! {otp9884_backup_started, Tag, self()},
 7965:     receive
 7966:         {otp9884_backup_continue, Tag, Pid} ->
 7967:             ok
 7968:     end,
 7969:     ?IPRINT("[~w] backup start", [Tag]),
 7970:     Res = rpc:call(Node, snmpa, backup, [Dir]),
 7971:     ?IPRINT("[~w] backup result: ~p", [Tag, Res]),
 7972:     Pid ! {otp9884_backup_complete, Tag, Res}.
 7973: 
 7974: 
 7975: otp9884_await_backup_started() ->
 7976:     otp9884_await_backup_started(undefined, undefined).
 7977: 
 7978: otp9884_await_backup_started(First, Second)
 7979:   when is_pid(First) andalso is_pid(Second) ->
 7980:     ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_started -> order first continue"),
 7981:     First  ! {otp9884_backup_continue, first, self()},
 7982:     ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_started -> order second continue"),
 7983:     Second ! {otp9884_backup_continue, second, self()},
 7984:     ok;
 7985: otp9884_await_backup_started(First, Second) ->
 7986:     receive
 7987:         {otp9884_backup_started, first, Pid} when (First =:= undefined) ->
 7988:             ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_started -> received started from first"),
 7989:             otp9884_await_backup_started(Pid, Second);
 7990:         {otp9884_backup_started, second, Pid} when (Second =:= undefined) ->
 7991:             ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_started -> received started from second"),
 7992:             otp9884_await_backup_started(First, Pid)
 7993:     end.
 7994:     
 7995: otp9884_await_backup_completion(ok, Second) 
 7996:   when ((Second =/= ok) andalso (Second =/= undefined)) ->
 7997:     ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_completion -> "
 7998:             "first backup succeed and second failed (~p)", [Second]),
 7999:     ok;
 8000: otp9884_await_backup_completion(First, ok) 
 8001:   when ((First =/= ok) andalso (First =/= undefined)) ->
 8002:     ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_completion -> "
 8003:             "second backup succeed and first failed (~p)", [First]),
 8004:     ok;
 8005: otp9884_await_backup_completion(First, Second) 
 8006:   when (((First =:= undefined) andalso (Second =:= undefined)) 
 8007: 	orelse 
 8008: 	((First =:= undefined) andalso (Second =/= undefined)) 
 8009: 	orelse 
 8010: 	((First =/= undefined) andalso (Second =:= undefined))) ->
 8011:     ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_completion -> await complete messages"),
 8012:     receive
 8013: 	{otp9884_backup_complete, first, Res} ->
 8014: 	    ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_completion -> "
 8015:                     "received complete message for first: ~p", [Res]),
 8016: 	    otp9884_await_backup_completion(Res, Second);
 8017: 	{otp9884_backup_complete, second, Res} ->
 8018: 	    ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_completion -> "
 8019:                     "received complete message for second: ~p", [Res]),
 8020: 	    otp9884_await_backup_completion(First, Res)
 8021:     after 10000 ->
 8022: 	    %% we have waited long enough
 8023:             ?EPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_completion -> timeout"),
 8024: 	    throw({error, {timeout, First, Second}})
 8025:     end;
 8026: otp9884_await_backup_completion(First, Second) ->
 8027:     ?EPRINT("Bad Completion: "
 8028:             "~n      First:  ~p"
 8029:             "~n      Second: ~p", [First, Second]),
 8030:     throw({error, {bad_completion, First, Second}}).
 8031:
